title: Collage with Box of Matches

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of charcoal, with stumping, white chalk, and traces of red chalk, with three collage elements on tan wove paper, laid down on cream rag board.

medium_display: Charcoal, with stumping, white chalk, and traces of red chalk, with three collage elements on tan wove paper, laid down on cream rag board
inscriptions: Signed recto, lower right, in charcoal: "G.SEVerini 1912" ("SEV" retouched with graphite)
credit_line: Bequest of Joseph Winterbotham and purchased with funds provided by Curt Valentin and Mrs. Henry C. Woods
publication_history:
“Showing a Match-Box Picture Stuck On: ‘Still Life,’ by Severini-Puzzle, Disentangle the Objects,” The Sketch (April 16, 1913), no. 24 (ill.).

Bernhard Degenhart, Italienische Zeichner der Gegenwart (Berlin, 1956), no. 8 (ill.).

Ira Moskowitz, Great Drawings of All Time, 4 (New York, 1962) n.p., no. 1034 (ill.).

Georges Borgeaud, Témoinages: 50 ans de réflexion (Rome, 1963), p. 25 (ill.).

Una Johnson, Drawings of the Masters: Twentieth Century Drawings I (New York, 1964), p. 51, no. 19 (ill.).

Harold Joachim, "A Still Life by Gino Severini," Bulletin of The Art Institute of Chicago 69:6 (November-December 1975), pp. 6-7 (ill.).

Daniela Fonti, Gino Severini: Catalogo Ragionato (Milan, 1988), p. 148, no. 142 (ill.).
exhibition_history:
London, Marlborough Gallery, "Severini," April 1913, hors cat.

Naples, Galleria Futurista, "The First Futurist Exhibition," May-June 1914, cat. 30.

Berlin, Der Strum, 1915.

Hartford, Conn., Wadsworth Atheneum, "Salute to Italy," April 21-May 28, 1961, p. 41.

New York, Museum of Modern Art, "Futurism," May 31–September 5, 1961, hors. cat; traveled to The Detroit Institute of Arts, and the Los Angeles County Museum of Art.

The Art Institute of Chicago, "Great Drawings from The Art Institute of Chicago: The Harold Joachim Years 1958-1983," July 24-September 30, 1985, pp. 182-183, cat. 84 (ill.), cat. by Martha Tedeschi.

The David and Alfred Smart Gallery, The University of Chicago, "Multiple Perspectives: Cubism in Chicago Collections," October 6-December 2, 1991.

New Haven, Conn., Yale University Art Gallery, "Severini futurista: 1912–1917," October 18, 1995–January 7, 1996, pp. 75, 76 (ill.), and 77 (ill.), cat. 8, fig. 24; traveled to Fort Worth, Tex., Kimbell Art Museum, February 11–April 7, 1996.
provenance_text: The artist, to at least 1956 [Degenhart 1956].  New Gallery, New York, by 1961 [Hartford, Conn. 1961].  Mr. and Mrs. E. V. Thaw, Alpine, NJ., by 1962 [Moskowitz 1962].  Joseph Tucker, St. Louis [invoice].  Sold by the Allan Frumkin Gallery, Chicago, to the Art Institute, 1974.
copyright_notice: © 2018 Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York / ADAGP, Paris
